column4: Hello, all, I just installed ubuntu, I like it, but where's gcc? what's the ubuntu way of installing it?
install the 'build-essential' package
look in synaptic
system -> administration -> synaptic
build-essential is on the ubuntu install CD
yeah, that's a slightly simpler interface
just install build-essential ;)
unless you are highly clueful wrt gcc or need a specific version
'build-essential' will install the default
I don't think either, just asking
if you are a slackware veteran, ubuntu should be super-easy
running joke, 'ubuntu' is an african word for 'those to lazy to configure slackware'
would it still work?
the ubuntu policy is to use sudo, generally
yeah, my point was i don't think you'll break anything (that is a guess though)
wiki instructions for installing ati
should be easier than by hand
it's up to you of course ;)
only the original user can use sudo, by default
isn't there a gcc-3.4 package?
do you have non-standard repos ? (marillat, backports, etc.)
I didn't do nothing
yeah, breezy's not final yet
sounds like gcc-3.4 shuold 'just work'
